citations.narrative:
Certain medical records were not maintained for dogs sold and held by the licensee. The licensee stated that he performs
monthly preventive care and treatment, according to the written Program of Veterinary Care, to ensure unmatted hair
coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and health eyes, ears, skin and teeth. Additionally, the licensee stated that he
administers heartworm prevention, treatment for intestinal parasites, and vaccinations according to the written Program of
Veterinary Care. However, at the time of the inspection the following medical prevention checks and treatments were not
recorded: 1) monthly preventive health care and treatment for all the adult dogs, 2) monthly administration of heartworm
prevention for all of the adult dogs, 3) annual distemper virus, parvovirus, and leptospirosis vaccination for some of the
adult dogs, 4) distemper virus, parvovirus vaccination and intestinal parasite medication administration for litters of
puppies that had been sold by the licensee since the last inspection. Medical records are essential for APHIS inspectors
to evaluate the quality of medical care provided by the facility and ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury,
and illness.
Dealers must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These
records must include routine husbandry procedures, such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, or treatments,
performed on all animals.
To be corrected by the close of business on 11/8/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Certain medical records were not maintained for dogs sold and held by the licensee. The licensee stated that he performs 
monthly preventive care and treatment, according to the written Program of Veterinary Care, to ensure unmatted hair 
coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and health eyes, ears, skin and teeth. Additionally, the licensee stated that he 
administers heartworm prevention, treatment for intestinal parasites, and vaccinations according to the written Program of 
Veterinary Care. However, at the time of the inspection the following medical prevention checks and treatments were not 
recorded: 1) monthly preventive health care and treatment for all the adult dogs, 2) monthly administration of heartworm 
prevention for all of the adult dogs, 3) annual distemper virus, parvovirus, and leptospirosis vaccination for some of the 
adult dogs, 4) distemper virus, parvovirus vaccination and intestinal parasite medication administration for litters of 
puppies that had been sold by the licensee since the last inspection. Medical records are essential for APHIS inspectors 
to evaluate the quality of medical care provided by the facility and ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury, 
and illness. 
 
Dealers must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These 
records must include routine husbandry procedures, such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, or treatments, 
performed on all animals. 
 
To be corrected by the close of business on 11/8/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
